meanings.definition: The natural satellite of the Earth.
meanings.sent1: At night, the moon shines brightly in the sky.
meanings.sent2: I love looking at the moon through my telescope.
meanings.sent3: The owl hooted at the moon, thinking it was a giant owl.
meanings.sent4: The moon's reflection on the lake was like a silver coin on water.
meanings.sent5: During the full moon, the night feels magical and bright.

meanings.definition: To spend time idly, aimlessly, or foolishly.
meanings.sent1: After finishing my homework, I like to moon around in the park.
meanings.sent2: Don't just moon around, help me with the chores!
meanings.sent3: He decided to moon around the house instead of doing his work.
meanings.sent4: She would rather moon around than be productive.
meanings.sent5: The cat likes to moon around lazily in the sunbeam.

meanings.definition: To expose one's buttocks to someone in order to insult or amuse them.
meanings.sent1: During the prank, he decided to moon his friends from the window.
meanings.sent2: The mischievous boy thought it would be funny to moon the teacher.
meanings.sent3: He dared his friend to moon the passing cars, which caused a lot of laughter.
meanings.sent4: The rebellious teenager thought it was cool to moon strangers.
meanings.sent5: The comedian decided to moon the audience for a laugh.
